Detailed Description

Main class of project.

This is the Point Region Quadtree.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Quadtree::Quadtree ( float  left,
float  width,
float  down,
float  height,
int  maxDepth 
)

Creates the tree. Once the tree is created the dimensions can't be changed.

Parameters:
leftLeft x-coordinate.
widthWidth of scene.
downDown y-coordinate.
heightHeight of scene.
maxDepthMax depth of each node (maximum subdivisions of root region).
Quadtree::~Quadtree ( )

Destructor. Deallocates the tree and all of its nodes (but not the data).

Member Function Documentation

void Quadtree::addPos ( IRO_Point2D *  posPtr)

Adds a point to the scene.

Parameters:
posPtrPoint to be added.
Quadtree_node * Quadtree::find ( IRO_Point2D *  posPtr) const [private]

Does a tree search to find a node. The implemented search is depth first.

Returns:
The node if found, else null (0).
std::vector< IRO_Point2D * > Quadtree::getContentAt ( float  x,
float  y 
) const

Returning content in smalles region containing the point. Not very usefull method since it requires the user to understand how the tree subdivied the scene.

Parameters:
xX-coordinate.
yY-coordinate.
Returns:
The content at the smallest subregion of point.
std::vector< IRO_Point2D * > Quadtree::getContentInRect ( float  left,
float  down,
float  right,
float  up 
) const

Returning content in a rectangular area.

Parameters:
leftLeft x-coordinate of rectangle.
downDown y-coordinate of rectangle.
rightRight x-coordinate of rectangle.
upUp y-coordinate of rectangle.
Returns:
The content inside the rectangle.
Quadtree_node * Quadtree::getLeafAt ( float  x,
float  y 
) const [private]

Returns the node at the specified location.

Parameters:
xX-coordinate of location.
yY-coordinate of location.
Returns:
The node at the specified location.
Quadtree_node * Quadtree::getParent ( Quadtree_node *  node) const [private]

Returns the parent of the specified node.

Parameters:
nodeThe node.
Returns:
The parent of the node.
void Quadtree::removePos ( IRO_Point2D *  posPtr)

Removes a point from the scene. Will throw QuadtreeException::QE_badSearch if it cannot find point where it's supposed to be.

Parameters:
posPtrPosition to be removed.
void Quadtree::updatePos ( IRO_Point2D *  posPtr)

Updates a point, must be called directly after change in position. It is faster to remove a point, move the point and then add the point to the scene again.

Parameters:
posPtrPoint to be updated.
